intro: Plagiobothrys rufescens var. laxiflorus, commonly known as the redstem sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences. This variety is distinguished by its more loosely arranged flowers compared to other varieties of Plagiobothrys rufescens.
